review: okay im 23 hours in the game is definetly niche its a  visual novel that plays like a series of anime its got tactical gameplay so think waterd down fire emblem if you arent a fan of digimon or dont really care for the series this isnt for you its slow its clunky but for a digimon fan its actually really great kind of want them to make a game thats just the tactical aspect of this game i recommend it based on the moral system and tactial alone

digimon survive is genuinely one of my favorite games of all time its just the best visual novel you can play its especially great for digimon fans of the anime but its still great for anyone who is interested in digimon
nice

in typical animejrpg fashion the characters do a lot of talking sometimes visiting the same subjects over and over again which does test the patience for sure  but that aside its a perfectly fun game with a dark and intriguing story i love how digimon aged with its audience it does not shy away from darker themes that kids today just cant handle and this game captures that perfectly isolated in a world they dont know with only their digimon partners to depend on
very boring super packed roster of boring characters who say nothing interesting takes forever to get to an actual battle
this game is broken on the steam deck

i enjoy visual novels and am okay at tactical rpgs i really enjoy the tones this game has vs other digimon games and suggest it if you are a digimon fan and a visual novel enjoyer the combat is like maybe 40 of the game less if youre not going for 100  definitely suggest two playthroughs as the first one might leave you a bit unsatisfied for spoiler reasons

mostly a horror vn so if youre into that youll like it high quality art and voice acting the tacticscreature collecting aspect is definitely the secondary gameplay with it being maybe 20 of the game it is fun but the vn aspect is definitely the main draw if you dont like vns you wont like this game

good game only complaint is that i oneshot fangmon with a level 29 greymon and yet the dialouge afterwards still pretended that said greymon had little energy left and would have a hard time fighting again despite attacking a total of twice once on the boss and once on a minion during the entire fight the ease of battle does not impact how characters act after battle
definitely much better than people made it out to be worth it for the story

for the price point this game is far more a visual novel with a sprinkle of disappointing clunky tactical rpg  8 hours in and i feel like ive gotten nowhere the battles i just automate and ignore perhaps this game style is no longer my preference  at least its giving some of those nostalgia feels
dont buy the fucking dlc of guilmon you can have it without paying

so i love digimon and i love games like final fantasy tactics so i was excited well no one told me i was about to play neon genesis digimon no one told me my heart was about to be ripped out and punched repeatedly before being defecated upon im only on chapter 6 at one point i had to just put my controller down mid fight and just walk away and hug my children ive never been hurt this much by any game in my life anyway 1010 recommend if you have a therapist

honestly got this game while it was on sale thinking it was gonna be another game full of filler content and horrible game physics but this game exceeded all of my expectations for an anime game especially a digimon one at that but the story line is so good its not predictable like the tv shows or movies and it takes on a whole different aspect of digimon and would highly recommend to any anime game player or digimon lover its a must have and must play game for sure

ok so im a fps girl i actually hate interactive story book games and turn based combat but despite that i am a huge digimon fan and decided to give the game a play anyway i still hate both those game types but if you like that style then this is a gorgeously presented package were i to actually enjoy this kind of game this would easily be my favourite

this history is amazing however it is not your typical digimon game  its dark as hell and interesting as nothing ive played before while playing i feel the developers were always trying to subvert the expectations and they did it masterfuly  the pacing can be a little slow with the visual novel elements however its a great game and any digimon fan should try it

digimon survive is an emotional gripping actionfilled adventure that kept me invested from the moment i entered the digital world while the gameplay isnt vast the combat is deep and both compliment the visual novel style of the game digimon survive may not be for everyone looking for a more direct influence on the story outside of dialogue options but it delivers on what it promised an amazing digimon adventure for a whole new generation
